column1: Week 4 - Once the blastocyst reaches the uterus, it buries itself in the uterine wall.
- At this point in the mother's menstrual cycle, the lining of the uterus is thick with blood and ready to support a baby.
This includes certain medicines, illegal drug use, heavy alcohol use, infections such as rubella, and other factors.
- Nails appear on the fingers and toes.
- Fine hair called lanugo develops on baby's head.
- The mother may feel a fluttering in the lower abdomen.
- The baby is more active with increased muscle development.
- The lower airways of the baby's lungs develop.
Week 38 to 40 - Lanugo is gone except for on the upper arms and shoulders.
